definition: to press against/to support/to prop up/to resist/to equal/to balance/to make up for/to mortgage/to arrive at/to clap (one's hands) lightly (expressing delight) (Taiwan pr. [zhi3] for this sense)
to use/to employ/to have to/to eat or drink/expense or outlay/usefulness/hence/therefore
bond (esp. document split in two, with each party holding one half)/contract/deed (i.e. title deeds)/ticket/voucher/certificate

sentences.english: The vouchers can be used in the restaurant or the lounge.
sentences.chinese: 抵用券可在餐廳及會客廳使用。

sentences.english: But we don't offer vouchers to employees.
sentences.chinese: 但我們不給予員工抵用券。

sentences.english: The only difference is in the restaurant and bar vouchers.
sentences.chinese: 唯一不同的在於餐廳和吧檯抵用券。

sentences.english: Purchase a RMB20 redemption voucher and obtain a boarding pass at the service counter.
sentences.chinese: 上車前需購買20元抵用券併到服務櫃檯取得乘車證。

definition: to exchange for (sth of equal value or utility)/to use in lieu/to redeem (a coupon etc)/to use to offset (an amount owed etc)
to draw a prize/a lottery/a raffle
buy one, get one free/two for the price of one
abbr. for 特別優惠|特别优惠[te4 bie2 you1 hui4]/ex gratia
(Tw) to put money into (a stored-value card or pre-paid phone account)/to top up
store credit (credit to be spent at a specified retailer)
